Posts.Content: GointoCarolina wrote: Should I be able to see and feel where the catheter goes from the neck incision to the port? Never noticed it until last night.Just is kind of weird.It was done almost three weeks ago and used this past Thursday.Still sore,but not bad. Jackie DX8/2008 IDC,Stage 1,Grade 3,0/3 nodes,ER/PR-,HER2+ Uni Left Mast 9/05/08 chemo & herceptin... Proph Right Mast with TEs March 2010,April 2010 TEs removed due to pain Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Port question: Catheter from neck to port GointoCarolina bluedasher

Posts.Content: GointoCarolina wrote: I will have my fifth cycle of 6(Taxotere,Carboplatin,Herceptin) this coming Thursday.My white counts dipped the first time,but the next two times were OK.The 4th cycle I had severe gastritis,ended up in the hospital the day before Christmas Eve,then spiked a fever ,I was neutropenic,so had to stay and have IV antibiotics.I finally got to come home New Years Day. My doctor is considering Neulasta for my last two cycles.I am wondering if anyone else has had a fever when neutropenic and what precautions were taken? I know they were super careful; with me as I was already in the hospital and exposed to everything under the sun.All my cultures were negative.I really want to avoid the Neulasta if I can,I hate even taking Tylenol,but will of course do it if needed.Would like to hear from everyone. Thanks!!! Jackie DX8/2008 IDC,Stage 1,Grade 3,0/3 nodes,ER/PR-,HER2+ Uni Left Mast 9/05/08 chemo & herceptin... Proph Right Mast with TEs March 2010,April 2010 TEs removed due to pain Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Neulasta Info please GointoCarolina GointoCarolina

Posts.Content: GointoCarolina wrote: A dear friend called this morning,he wanted to tell me he had done some research on these Miracle berries and found that they can help with taste during chemo.He said the actual berries are very expensive,but there are tablets.Has anyone tried them? If so, did they work and where did you get them? If no one else has tried them,I will and will post results. Posts.Content: GointoCarolina wrote: On the HER2 board,someone poasted that they are only receiving 4 cycles of TCH.I spoke with my onciologist and he wanted more info.If there is anyone who is receiving only 4 cycles of taxotere,carboplatin and herceptin(herceptin would still be one year)can you please let me know and where you are located? My onc wants to do what is best for me with the least amount of chemo.He wondered if there were any studies on this.THANKS!!! Posts.Title: Question on TCH 4 cycles versus 6?? GointoCarolina jackifp

Posts.Content: GointoCarolina wrote: I had a proph mast and tissue expanders placed March 28,had to have expanders removed April 21 due to extreme pain.I still have a lot of pain on my sides where the drains came out of my body,not all the time,but still too sore to sleep on my side.Has anyone else had this? Posts.Title: Pain where drains were removed? GointoCarolina VickiSam

Posts.Content: GointoCarolina wrote: On August 12 I had bilateral SGAP reconstruction ,14 hour surgery,one side faiiled,out of state.The flights home one week after surgery were delayed,so I know that was a set back.I had severe pain from the hip drains,they were removed 4 days ago.I was not sleeping well until last night,hoping I will sleep tonight.I am off all pain meds.But I am so tired,I am still not back to my routine,not able to cook or clean. A shower tires me out.I am not anemic,will see my doctor on Friday,he is very concerned that I have no energy.Has anyone else had a hard time bouncing back from surgery?
